snippet: Fathi Ben Haj Yahia, a school director, former political prisoner and Marxist writer, laments that political theorists have failed to forge something new out of Tunisia’s 2011 uprising.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Fathi Ben Haj Yahia, Tunisian author and political activist who has led a life of resistance and opposition through five tumultuous decades in the Middle East.
lead_paragraph: Fathi Ben Haj Yahia, a school director, former political prisoner and Marxist writer, laments that political theorists have failed to forge something new out of Tunisia’s 2011 uprising.

headline.print_headline: A Product of Tunisia’s 1960s Resistance Continues to Protest
headline.main: A Product of Tunisia’s 1960s Resistance Continues to Protest
